(fn rotate-sequence
  [n v]
  ;; return the sequence rotated by n steps in left direction if n > 0
  ;; rotated by n steps in right direction if n < 0
  (let 
   [c (count v)
    f (fn [cnt len arr] (if 
    (and (>= cnt 0) (<= cnt len)) (concat (drop cnt arr) (take cnt arr))
    (concat (drop (rem cnt len) arr) (take (rem cnt len) arr))))]
    (if (< n 0) (reverse (f (* n -1) c (reverse v))) (f n c v))))

; Second Try:
; Here I attempted to make a lazy seq (`pattern`) that just yielded the list of 
; items in the correct order over and over, shift that lazy seq the required amount, 
; and then take the correct number of items from that shifted seq. Having to support 
; negative offsets that are greater than the length of the collection makes this a little messy.
(fn [n col]
  (let [length  (count col)
        pattern (cycle col)
        shift   (mod n length)
        shifted (drop shift pattern)] 
    (take length shifted)))

          (conj (vec (drop 1 new-coll)) (get (vec coll) (mod cnt (count coll))))
          (inc cnt))

  (cond

   (recur (- n (count lst)) lst)
   (> (* -1 n) (count lst))

   (> 0 n)
   (concat
    (drop (+ (count lst) n) lst)
    (take (+ (count lst) n) lst)

(fn rotate
  [n aseq]
  (let [rotdown (fn [x]
                  (concat (rest x) [(first x)]))
        rotup (fn [x]
                (concat [(last x)] (butlast x)))]

    (if (> n 0)
      (loop [out aseq
             x n]
        (if (zero? x)
          out
          (recur (rotdown out) (dec x))))
      (loop [out aseq
             x n]
        (if (zero? x)
          out
          (recur (rotup out) (inc x)))))))
